sub_title: Upcoming Associate M&A Tax at PwC
summary:
Proverbs 3:13 - Blessed are those who find wisdom, those who gain understanding.

Currently I am studying at the Erasmus University Rotterdam for my Master in Tax Law. After high school I started with Tax Law due to the fact that it assembles my passions which are strategy, policy, reasoning and economics. Next to my studies I have increased my Tax Law knowledge at BDO, EY and PwC as an intern.

I am Christian and believe that we are given the oppurtunity to develop ourselves to the fullest as human beings; to use these talents and make ethical and just decisions.

After work I can be found playing chess, cycling or on the couch reading a book. Besides those hobby's, my biggest passion will remain travel. My favourite destinations have been Hawaii, Iceland and Rwanda.

[{'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'role': 'Volunteer in Malawi and Rwanda', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'World Servants', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFHIOn8hobFVw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519884798467?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=P0FjTFyKdO0suG6aFgE5qX5mUEevvhEn2LipnGy9K7E', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-servants/'}, 'cause': None, 'description': "From 2018 and onwards I have been fundraising for different projects with World Servants. We built houses and schools, next to this we organised daily activities with the local children.

In 2019 I led the Footwall4Water programme, which is an incentive sponsored by KNVB and Unicef to enforce hygiene lessons in combination with football games. 

In 2022 I was one of the three participants who led the 'Life Skills' programme.
